post_text: Looking for something for your preschooler that's not a full-time commitment? Then look no further! Check out Roxbury High School's Preschool Program. Enrollments are now being accepted for the 3 year old program.
shared_text:
Roxbury Public Schools
March 8, 2019 at 10:54 AM ·

Roxbury HS Preschool Program is now accepting enrollments for 2019/2020. If you're looking for something for your preschooler that's not a full-time commitment, then look no further!

Roxbury High School's preschool program is now accepting enrollments for their October 2nd start date. Roxbury and non-Roxbury residents welcome!

The program for three-year-olds meets Wednesday through Friday from 11:45 a.m. to 1:45 p.m. at Roxbury High School at 1 Bryant Drive in Succasunna for $75 a month.

Interested families should contact Barbara Kroog, RHS Family & Consumer Sciences Teacher bkroog@roxbury.org or at 973-584-1200 x0393.

The Roxbury High School Preschool Program has been serving the community since 1973 and has two preschool programs, one for three-year-olds and one for four-year-olds. For more information regarding the program, please visit https://sites.google.com/a/roxbury.org/roxbury-high-school-preschool-program/.

We all love living here so let’s be sure to do our part and help keep our town clean and beautiful.

ROXBURY SCHOOLS ANNOUNCEMENT 10/17/17

Don’t forget New Jersey! Today’s the last day to register to vote in the upcoming Tuesday, November 7th General Election! Register to vote at http://nj.gov/state/elections.

Want a chance to see your local candidates running for the Roxbury Board of Education? Tonight’s the night to Meet the Candidates in the Lincoln/Roosevelt School Auditorium at 34 N. Hillside Avenue in Succasunna beginning at 7 pm. This evening’s debate style format hosted by the L/R PTO will be moderated by the NJ League of Women Voters.

Brief candidate bios can be found at https://goo.gl/YhnciX.

We hope to see you there!

ROXBURY SCHOOLS ANNOUNCEMENT 10/17/17

Get your tickets now for Roxbury High School’s Performing Arts fall drama, All in the Timing! Shows are Thursday, November 2nd and Friday, November 3rd at 7 pm in RHS Auditorium.

Tickets are $10 each and going fast!

'All in the Timing' is a collection of six one-act plays by David Ives. Each comedic short deals with relationships and the role that timing plays in their success or demise. In its entirety, the show touches on historical figures and events, classic literature, foreign language, classical music (audible mathematics), and scientific experimentation. Basically, something for every discipline!

The Roxbury High School Volleyball Team will be hosting their annual Dig Pink Night on Monday, October 16th at Roxbury High School (1 Bryant Drive, Succasunna, NJ). The freshmen team plays at 4:00, followed by the JV team at 5:30 and Varsity at 7:00 pm. Free admission. Register now for Roxbury Riders, a new middle school program through the Roxbury Community School!

The goal of the Roxbury Community School’s Cycling program is to provide students with the opportunity to safely ride their bikes on local trails and to expose as many students to the value of cycling, which offers a low risk for injury but high cardiac output activity. This lifelong sport is a unique alternative to fitness and is something that is both social and challenging. As a group, students will work collaboratively to set goals and develop a wide range of valuable skills.

The program starts Tuesday! Register now at www.roxbury.org/RoxburyRiders!
